Ok, simply put, this was cool and different.  There was a line and not sure if it was because of the novelty or because it was good.  We were the only people that were non-Asian in line and most ordered only one small box, which was $9 for 8 small pieces.
The dessert was good.  I love the texture and the flavor, which taste "peanutbuttery".  I read on a posting that it was like an Abazaba, very similar in taste, but not as chewy.  They only had one flavor when we went, but I guess they have strawberry and coffee flavors as well. 
You can see the guy making it and it was an experience that I have not witnessed before.
Next time I am in SF will come back to try again.
author: AJ R.

description: Awesome, craft made. Delicious And and the service was excellent. My husband loved it!!
author: Mel A.

description: The best dragon beard candy I have ever had! And I have tried a ton! Not too sweet, perfect peanut filling and the candy is not hard or caked like other places. Support these elderly owners and the almost lost art of making Dragon Beard Candy right in front of consumers!
author: Tracy O.

description: $9 bucks for a box of 8 to share amongst friends. It's way better than the ones you buy in Hong Kong airport. These are fresh and the exterior melts in your mouth. Best afternoon treat ever!
author: Grace Y.

description: I am so glad that someone open this traditional chinese candy place. Staffs were friendly and nice. I understand the rent and wage are high in sf, but $9 per box for the drgon beard candy is little too much. I still recommend ppl go get it and try it. Maybe they should do some discount for ppl who buy more than 2 or 3 boxes.
author: B B.

description:
its like eating fine cotton candy wrapped around peanuts, coconut and sesame seeds.
Delicious! Im kinda feeling guilty because I ate all 8 pieces. Goes good with a glass of milk.
author: James G.

description: This a little hole in the wall spot in San Fransisco's china town! Oh my goodness, the dragon beard candy is so light  filled with peanuts! Also they have ginger candy and mochi covered in peanuts. They make everything fresh and the mochi is still warm! Please stop by and try some candy!
author: Angela L.

description: The bearded candy is really nutty and sweet, it feels like peanut butter. It starts out as a cool stringy candy and then it condenses in your mouth. Ultimately ends up tasting like a chick o stick or a peanut butter bar in your mouth.  It is a bit expensive for a little candy but I'm certain this is fair given the amount of labor.must try
author: Lewis B.

description: This small hole in the wall dessert shop was really fun to eat at the dragons beard was very good as was the mochi!    This is a take out joint.  They make the dragons beard on on-site right in front of you.  We loved it.  Highly recommended it!
author: Salaish S.

description: Tradition still exists!!! The old fashion pulled string candies is still around. The owner of the place is super duper nice. The texture is super unique and the peanut fillings, Mmmm. It is a bit on the pricey side for such a small package. And i also do wish the filling was a tad sweeter, just a tad. But Try their ginger candy also, really good!
author: Jeannie B.

description: This traditional Chinese dessert reminds me of my childhood. $9 for memories, art, story & history behind the dessert, it is totally worth it! I bought a box shared with friends, everyone loves it!
author: Cof Y.

description: If you know and enjoy these Chinese old time candy you won't be disappointed~ this is the best place to get fresh hand made candy.
author: Alice C.

description: it's a cute idea, and yes they make it fresh.  HOWEVER, $9 for like 6-8 little pieces. come on.
author: Food Is L.

description: Dragon Beard is a delicate and delicious dessert!  I had these when I was visiting Hong Kong, and these were just as good.  They're a bit pricey ($9 for 8 pieces).  I would come back when I visit Chinatown, which isn't too frequent, thankfully.  The lady said you can fridge the Dragon Beard for up to 3 months to preserve the freshness.  I didn't believe her at first, but I gave it a try since I wanted to share with my family.  Indeed it still tasted fresh after a week in the fridge!
author: Icy H.

description: I have been waiting for this for years!  They make authentic dragon beard candy, just like how I remembered it growing up in HK.  Took my kids there for the first time and they were mesmerized by how it's made and how delicious they are.  They were initially skeptical but now are full converts to Dragon Beard Candy!
author: G. W.

description: I love dragon beard candy since I was a kid. Dragon Papa is the best I've ever tried, be honest. The original flavor is definitely a must-try!
author: Christy K.

description: That's where I have dragon beard candy for over 5 times and today I tried Mochi which is another surprise. The peanut and sesame are so fine and smooth and that's I did not try in another dessert places in the Bay Area. The Mochi is warm and soft but not too sweet. It just super yum and I shall go and get more for my friends and family next time. Can't wait and get more tomorrow!
author: Priscilla L.

description: Wow! Dragon Beard candy is absolutely delicious! It's freshly made and the taste is just right - not too sweet, but with just enough sweetness. The outer layer (white cocoon) melts in you mouth. The owners are super friendly, too. Cash only, so be sure and hit the ATM before you head over.
author: Nancy T.

description: Bomb candy. Gotta get the warm Mochi and the cold dragon beard candy. Always get 5 boxes when I'm in town.
author: Tiff P.

description: Came in w/ my girlfriend, bought 2 packs of the dragon beard candy and 3 packs of ginger rock candies. We had to admit both were better than we expected, the beard candy and ginger rock were sweet but not too overpowering, very addictive! Worth the price after seeing the process and taking the initial bite. Additionally the employee that explained the process was very kind and respectful, great experience. I highly recommend this place.
author: Ozzie B.

description: Actually, 3.5 stars. I just had to try this, it looked so interesting! I had a dessert in Thailand that looked strange, but was actually yummy, & I thought this would be similar. When I ate 1 of the rolls, my 1st thought was "is this a food product"? The outer floss stuff is a bit weird. Not very sweet or tasty at all. I enjoyed the peanut/coconut filling, but it's chopped so fine that it gets stuck all up in the crevices of my teeth. I also bought the mochi that was warm & rolled in the same peanut stuff, that was yummy, but same problem w/the filling getting stuck in between my teeth. All-in-all, although pricey, but I don't regret buying it. The young man who was probably the son was very pleasant, it's a small business, & it was interesting to try. Support the local small businesses, right? Oh, BTW, the rolls when chilled have a little crunch to them which is a little more interesting compared to not chilled.
author: susan w.
